### Explore

   * What is database? 
  
   * Different types of databases -primary, secondary database ?
  
   * Different database (On basis of date stored)- genomic database like UCSC, Ensembl 
   
   * Go to the webpage of databases and explore (What information are there, how can you download or retrieve the information, etc.)
   
   * Genomic feature, Genomic assembly, Genomic variation.
   
   * Different file formats- FASTA, FASTAQ, BED, GFF, GTF, VCF.
   
### Useful links

##### Links to important database.

   * [Ensembl](https://www.ensembl.org/index.html), [Ensembl User Guides](https://www.ensembl.org/info/website/tutorials/index.html)
   
   * [UCSC](https://genome.ucsc.edu/), [UCSC User Guide](https://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/hgTracksHelp.html)
   
   * [NCBI](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov), [NCBI_TP53gene](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene/7157)
   
   * [DDBJ](https://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/index-e.html)
   
   * [INSDC](https://www.insdc.org (to explore))
   
##### Great guide on file formats
  
   * Describes all types of file formats - https://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat.html
   
##### Review article on human database
   * https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4411498/
   
##### EBI Summary
   
   * https://www.ebi.ac.uk

   * https://www.ebi.ac.uk/training/online/courses/bioinformatics-terrified/the-role-of-public-databases/
